text.0: high hymns have sounded forth the praise of maghavan supporter of mankind of indra meet for lauds.
text.1: him who hath waxen great invoked with beauteous songs immortal one whose praise each day is sung aloud.
text.2: to indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise the lord of hundred powers strong hero like the sea.
text.3: swift winner of the booty breakerdown of forts faithful and everglorious finder of the light.
text.4: where battles spoil is piled the singer winneth praise for indra taketh care of matchless worshippers.
text.5: he in vivasvāns dwelling findeth his delight praise thou the everconquering slayer of the foe.
text.6: thee valorous most heroic of the heroes shall the priests glorify with songg and praises.
text.7: full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest worship is his sole lord from days aforetime.
text.8: abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures.
text.9: the heavens the growing plants the living waters the forest trees preserve their wealth for indra.
text.10: to thee o indra lord of bays for ever are offered prayers and songs accept them gladly.
text.11: as kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance good friend give strength and life to those who praise thee.
text.12: here indra drink thou soma with the maruts as thou didst drink the juice beside Śāryāta.
text.13: under thy guidance in thy keeping hero the singers serve skilled in fair sacrifices.
text.14: so eagerly desirous drink the soma our juice o indra with thy friends the maruts.
text.15: since at thy birth all deities adorned thee for the great fight o thou invoked of many.
text.16: he was your comrade in your zeal o maruts they rich in noble gifts rejoiced in indra.
text.17: with them together let the vṛtraslayer drink in his home the worshippers libation.
text.18: so lord of affluent gifts this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength.
text.19: drink of it thou who lovest song.
text.20: incline thy body to this juice which suits thy godlike nature well.
text.21: may it cheer thee who lovest it.
text.22: brave indra let it work through both thy flanks and through thy head by prayer.
text.23: and through thine arms to prosper us.
